title: Wacker opens €50m VAE reactor in US to expand dispersions capacity
text:
Wacker opens €50m VAE reactor in US to expand dispersions capacity 22 October 2015 
German chemical group Wacker Chemie has opened a new reactor for vinyl acetate-ethylene copolymer (VAE) dispersions at its Calvert City site in Kentucky, US, investing around €50m. 
With an annual capacity of 85,000t, the company aims to meet the demand for its VAE-based dispersions and dispersible powders worldwide. 
Wacker Chemie CEO Rudolf Staudigl said: "Our production complex in Calvert City is the largest of its kind outside of Europe, supporting our successful, customer-focused global growth strategy. 
"Demand for our high-quality VAE products continues to increase, especially for formulating low-emission, eco-friendly products. 
"The additional capacity allows us to continue to meet our customers' needs reliably over the coming years, solidifying our leading global market position." "Demand for our high-quality VAE products continues to increase, especially for formulating low-emission, eco-friendly products." 
Wacker has had a presence in Calvert City since 1998. Its VINNAPAS dispersions are used as binders in the construction, paints, coatings, and adhesives industries. 
Wacker Polymers has production sites in Germany, China, South Korea, and the US, and global sales network and technical centers in all major regions. 
The company also expanded its Mexico-based technical centre to include dispersion applications this month. 
The expansion of the Mexico technical centre helps to expand production of VAE dispersions. 
The company is focusing on expansion activities for the next two years, which includes beginning polysilicon production at the new site in Tennessee, expanding their Burghausen site's capacity of dispersible polymer powders by 50,000t, and other projects.
